query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 O Simon mago, o miseri seguaci 2 che le cose di Dio, che di bontate 3 deon essere spose, e voi rapaci
4 per oro e per argento avolterate, 5 or convien che per voi suoni la tromba, 6 però che ne la terza bolgia state.
query.result:
1 O Simon magician, or miserable followers 2 who the things of God, which of goodness 3 ought to be spouses, and you rapacious ones
4 for gold and for silver you turn around, 5 now it is necessary that for you the trumpet sounds, 6 because in the third *bolgia* you are.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Già eravamo, a la seguente tomba, 8 montati de lo scoglio in quella parte 9 ch’a punto sovra mezzo ’l fosso piomba.
query.result: 7 Already we were, to the following tomb, 8 climbed from the rock on that part 9 which directly above the middle of the ditch plunges.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 O somma sapïenza, quanta è l’arte 11 che mostri in cielo, in terra e nel mal mondo, 12 e quanto giusto tua virtù comparte!
13 Io vidi per le coste e per lo fondo 14 piena la pietra livida di fóri, 15 d’un largo tutti e ciascun era tondo.
query.result:
10 O highest wisdom, how great is the art 11 that you show in heaven, on earth and in the evil world, 12 and how justly your virtue distributes!
13 I saw on the slopes and on the bottom 14 filled the livid stone with holes, 15 of a large one each and every one was round.

16 They did not seem to me less wide nor larger 17 than those that are in my beautiful Saint John’s, 18 made for the place of the baptizers;
19 one of which, not many years ago, 20 I broke open because someone was drowning inside: 21 and let this be a seal that every man deceives.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Fuor de la bocca a ciascun soperchiava 23 d’un peccator li piedi e de le gambe 24 infino al grosso, e l’altro dentro stava.
query.result: 22 Outside the mouth to each one protruded 23 of a sinner the feet and the legs 24 up to the thick part, and the other was inside.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Le piante erano a tutti accese intrambe; 26 per che sì forte guizzavan le giunte, 27 che spezzate averien ritorte e strambe.

Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Qual suole il fiammeggiar de le cose unte 29 muoversi pur su per la strema buccia, 30 tal era lì dai calcagni a le punte.
query.result: 28 As is accustomed the flickering of the unctuous things 29 to move only up along the outermost peel, 30 such was there from the heels to the points.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 «Chi è colui, maestro, che si cruccia 32 guizzando più che li altri suoi consorti», 33 diss’ io, «e cui più roggia fiamma succia?».
query.result: 31 “Who is he, master, who torments himself 32 twitching more than his companions,” 33 I said, “and to whom more fiery rain sucks?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Ed elli a me: «Se tu vuo’ ch’i’ ti porti 35 là giù per quella ripa che più giace, 36 da lui saprai di sé e de’ suoi torti».
query.result: 34 And he to me: “If you want that I carry you 35 down there along that bank which lies more, 36 from him you will know of himself and of his wrongs.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 E io: «Tanto m’è bel, quanto a te piace: 38 tu se’ segnore, e sai ch’i’ non mi parto 39 dal tuo volere, e sai quel che si tace».
query.result: 37 And I: “So much is it beautiful to me, as it pleases you: 38 you are lord, and know that I do not depart 39 from your will, and you know what is kept silent.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Allor venimmo in su l’argine quarto; 41 volgemmo e discendemmo a mano stanca 42 là giù nel fondo foracchiato e arto.

Please translate each line literally into English.
43 Lo buon maestro ancor de la sua anca 44 non mi dipuose, sì mi giunse al rotto 45 di quel che si piangeva con la zanca.
query.result: 43 The good master still from his flank 44 did not remove me, so much did he come to the broken 45 of that which was lamented with the leg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 «O qual che se’ che ’l di sù tien di sotto, 47 anima trista come pal commessa», 48 comincia’ io a dir, «se puoi, fa motto».
query.result: 46 “O whoever you are who holds the above from below, 47 soul sad like a pale thing committed,” 48 I begin to say, “if you can, make a sign.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Io stava come ’l frate che confessa 50 lo perfido assessin, che, poi ch’è fitto, 51 richiama lui per che la morte cessa.
query.result: 49 I stood like the friar who confesses 50 the perfidious assassin, who, after he is struck, 51 recalls him so that death ceases.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Ed el gridò: «Se’ tu già costì ritto, 53 se’ tu già costì ritto, Bonifazio? 54 Di parecchi anni mi mentì lo scritto.
query.result: 52 And he cried: “Are you already standing there upright, 53 are you already standing there upright, Boniface? 54 Of many years my writing lied to me.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Se’ tu sì tosto di quell’ aver sazio 56 per lo qual non temesti tòrre a ’nganno 57 la bella donna, e poi di farne strazio?».
query.result: 55 Are you so quickly satisfied with that possession 56 for which you did not fear to take by deceit 57 the beautiful woman, and then to make her suffer torment?».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Tal mi fec’ io, quai son color che stanno, 59 per non intender ciò ch’è lor risposto, 60 quasi scornati, e risponder non sanno.
query.result: 58 Such did I make myself, like those who stay, 59 so as not to understand what is answered to them, 60 almost scorned, and do not know how to answer.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Allor Virgilio disse: «Dilli tosto: 62 “Non son colui, non son colui che credi”»; 63 e io rispuosi come a me fu imposto.

Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Per che lo spirto tutti storse i piedi; 65 poi, sospirando e con voce di pianto, 66 mi disse: «Dunque che a me richiedi?
67 Se di saper ch’i’ sia ti cal cotanto, 68 che tu abbi però la ripa corsa, 69 sappi ch’i’ fui vestito del gran manto;
70 e veramente fui figliuol de l’orsa, 71 cupido sì per avanzar li orsatti, 72 che sù l’avere e qui me misi in borsa.

Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Di sotto al capo mio son li altri tratti 74 che precedetter me simoneggiando, 75 per le fessure de la pietra piatti.
query.result: 73 Under my head are the other faces 74 that preceded me, simoniacing, 75 through the cracks of the stone, flattened.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Là giù cascherò io altresì quando 77 verrà colui ch’i’ credea che tu fossi, 78 allor ch’i’ feci ’l sùbito dimando.
query.result: 76 There below I also will fall when 77 will come he whom I believed that you were, 78 then when I made the sudden asking.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Ma più è ’l tempo già che i piè mi cossi 80 e ch’i’ son stato così sottosopra, 81 ch’el non starà piantato coi piè rossi:
82 ché dopo lui verrà di più laida opra, 83 di ver’ ponente, un pastor sanza legge, 84 tal che convien che lui e me ricuopra.
query.result:
79 But more is the time already that my feet have crossed 80 and that I have been so upside down, 81 that he will not remain planted with red feet:
82 because after him will come a more vile work, 83 from true west, a shepherd without law, 84 such that it is necessary that he and me cover.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Nuovo Iasón sarà, di cui si legge 86 ne’ Maccabei; e come a quel fu molle 87 suo re, così fia lui chi Francia regge».
query.result: 85 New Jason he will be, of whom one reads 86 in the Maccabees; and as to that one was weak 87 his king, so will he be he who rules France.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 Io non so s’i’ mi fui qui troppo folle, 89 ch’i’ pur rispuosi lui a questo metro: 90 «Deh, or mi dì: quanto tesoro volle
91 Nostro Segnore in prima da san Pietro 92 ch’ei ponesse le chiavi in sua balìa? 93 Certo non chiese se non “Viemmi retro”.
query.result:
88 I do not know if I was too foolish to be here, 89 that I purely responded to him in this verse: 90 “Oh, now tell me: how much treasure did
91 Our Lord first ask from Saint Peter 92 that he should put the keys in his bailiwick? 93 Certainly he asked nothing if not “Come behind me.””

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Né Pier né li altri tolsero a Matia 95 oro od argento, quando fu sortito 96 al loco che perdé l’anima ria.
query.result: 94 Nor Peter nor the others took from Matthias 95 gold or silver, when he was chosen 96 to the place that lost the wicked soul.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Però ti sta, ché tu se’ ben punito; 98 e guarda ben la mal tolta moneta 99 ch’esser ti fece contra Carlo ardito.

Please translate each line literally into English.
100 E se non fosse ch’ancor lo mi vieta 101 la reverenza de le somme chiavi 102 che tu tenesti ne la vita lieta,
103 io userei parole ancor più gravi; 104 ché la vostra avarizia il mondo attrista, 105 calcando i buoni e sollevando i pravi.
query.result:
100 And if it were not that still it forbids me 101 the reverence of the high keys 102 that you held in the happy life,
103 I would use words even more grave; 104 because your avarice saddens the world, 105 trampling the good and raising the wicked.

106 Of you the Evangelist became aware, 107 when she who sits upon the waters 108 was seen whoring with the kings to him;
109 she who was born with the seven heads, 110 and from the ten horns had argument, 111 until virtue pleased her husband.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Fatto v’avete dio d’oro e d’argento; 113 e che altro è da voi a l’idolatre, 114 se non ch’elli uno, e voi ne orate cento?
115 Ahi, Costantin, di quanto mal fu matre, 116 non la tua conversion, ma quella dote 117 che da te prese il primo ricco patre!».
query.result:
112 You have made yourselves a god of gold and silver; 113 and what else is from you to the idolater, 114 if not that he is one, and you pray to a hundred?
115 Ah, Constantine, of how much evil was mother, 116 not your conversion, but that dowry 117 that the first rich father took from you!».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 E mentr’ io li cantava cotai note, 119 o ira o coscïenza che ’l mordesse, 120 forte spingava con ambo le piote.
query.result: 118 And while I sang to them such songs, 119 oh wrath or conscience that bit him, 120 strongly pushed with both paws.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 I’ credo ben ch’al mio duca piacesse, 122 con sì contenta labbia sempre attese 123 lo suon de le parole vere espresse.
query.result: 121 I believe well that to my guide it pleased, 122 with so content lip always attended 123 the sound of the true words expressed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Però con ambo le braccia mi prese; 125 e poi che tutto su mi s’ebbe al petto, 126 rimontò per la via onde discese.

Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Né si stancò d’avermi a sé distretto, 128 sì men portò sovra ’l colmo de l’arco 129 che dal quarto al quinto argine è tragetto.
query.result: 127 Nor did he tire of having me held to himself, 128 so much he carried me over the crest of the arc 129 that from the fourth to the fifth embankment is carried.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Quivi soavemente spuose il carco, 131 soave per lo scoglio sconcio ed erto 132 che sarebbe a le capre duro varco.
query.result: 130 There sweetly he relieved the burden, 131 sweetly because of the rough and steep rock 132 that would be a hard passage for goats.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Indi un altro vallon mi fu scoperto.
query.result: 133 Then another valley was revealed to me.
